column4: Woohoo.  I finally figured out a way to get virtualbox to see my gzipped file as if they were not gzipped. :)
meaning you  have your virtual diks gziped?
What?
meaning you  have your virtual diks gziped? - << Kuwanger  <
No, no.  Although I probably could do that.
than what DID you gzip>
I have a directory full of gzipped files, becase zlibc can be used as a library preload under linux to access gzipped as non-gzipped files.
With wine, it's as easy as "LD_PRELOAD=uncompress.so wine <some program>".  But, "LD_PRELOAD=uncompress.so virtualbox" won't work.
-  how do they relate to virtuabox ??? than -
However, "LD_PRELOAD=uncompress.so rofs dir_full_of_gzips dir_full_of_ungzipped_files" then using the second dir...
niceeeee
Virtualbox is one of the few apps that seems to use system calls instead of library calls that zlibc can override.
So, I tricked a fuse filesystem to decompress files for me so even system-call running apps works.
that can sirriously trim down the size of your virtualbox  v-disks  :P
Yea..that could..but that's pretty crazy. :)
true
You'd be better off using one of the fuse filesystem tools that offers a custom compression to allow at least some semblance of random access.
hahahahha
Far as I'm aware, at least a few use a form of block compression.
maybe beter to minimize disk needance instead of  max the crompression :P
Btw, the directory in question has 738MB worth of gzip files.  That's why I didn't just decompress them.
